content:
Yes, there are several ski resorts in Lake Tahoe that have food trucks on site during the winter months. Here are a few examples:

1. Squaw Valley: Squaw Valley has several food trucks located at the base of the mountain, near the Funitel and the Cable Car. The food trucks offer a variety of cuisine, including tacos, burgers, and BBQ.
2. Heavenly Mountain Resort: Heavenly has a food truck located at the base of the mountain, near the Heavenly Village. The truck offers a variety of food, including burgers, sandwiches, and snacks.
3. Northstar California Resort: Northstar has several food trucks located throughout the resort, including at the Village at Northstar and at the base of the mountain. The trucks offer a variety of food, including pizza, burgers, and Mexican cuisine.
4. Kirkwood Mountain Resort: Kirkwood has a food truck located at the base of the mountain, near the Village Plaza. The truck offers a variety of food, including sandwiches, salads, and snacks.

Note that food truck offerings at ski resorts can vary from season to season and from year to year, so it's always a good idea to check with the resort directly for the most up-to-date information.
